Japanese leader Shinzo Abe resigned on Friday over health issues....
Abe is Japan's longest-serving prime minister...
...and has, for years, battled ulcerative colitis, an inflammatory bowel disease.
Two recent hospital visits within a week sparked speculation...
...as to whether he could stay in his job as prime minister...
...when his term as leader of the Liberal Democracy Party ends.
This is actually Abe's second term as prime minister.
He resigned in 2007 citing health reasons...
...and after a year of scandals, then he returned in 2012.
Abe's recently seen his support fall to one of the lowest levels...
...of his nearly eight years in office,...
...under fire for his handling of the novel coronavirus pandemic...
Abe's resignation will trigger a leadership race in the party,...
...the winner of which must be formally elected in parliament.
